Make sure rename srt file to same name as video mkv file...example if the video file name is Star.Wars.Episode.4.A.New.Hope.1977.BluRay.720p.DTS-ES.2Audio.x264-CHD.mkv than subfile name needs to be Star.Wars.Episode.4.A.New.Hope.1977.BluRay.720p.DTS-ES.2Audio.x264-CHD.srt

Not working for me for some reason.

Says 100% complete but can't open any files. File folder property says 0 kb?

If you download this and find you cannot open the file, it is most likely due to the poor file and folder names that are too long for windows to handle.  (Noob).

Do the following:

1.  Rename the Folder to a shorter name, it doesn't matter what.  Before you can rename the actual files, you must rename the folder.

2.  Right-Click the movie files and rename them to shorter names (i.e. Star Wars - Episode IV - A New Hope, etc.) 

3.  Watch movie.

WTF? Are you kidding me? ANY movie is worth paying for if you WANT to see them. But that's beside the point... DO YOU KNOW HOW MANY TIMES I'VE PAYED FOR THESE MOVIES ALLREADY?
First in '78 off my measly allowence (I had none btw), then again, and again e few years later, then the VHS boxset (pretty lousy timeworn), then again the remastered VHS boxset, then the DVD... 

I promised myself never to pay quadruple, triple or double again and wait for the BD to download.
